title: Wildfire Smoke Chokes Canada and U.S., Triggering Air Quality Alerts
summary:

title: NASA Told to Overhaul Its Plans to Replace the International Space Station
summary:
For nearly 30 years, the International Space Station has played orbital home for astronauts from all over the world, but its time is running out.
Slated to retire in 2030, NASA is aiming to replace it with a privately-run station that can host its astronauts in space when needed.
In a memo signed August 4, Duffy directs NASA to revise its Commercial Low Earth Orbit Destination program, which is designed to facilitate the development of commercial stations to replace the ISS.
Another major change is the revision to minimum capability requirements for an ISS replacement.

title: New Jersey reaches historic $2 billion environmental settlement with DuPont over 'forever chemicals'
summary:
Three chemical producers have reached a historic settlement with the state of New Jersey over "forever chemicals" and other pollutants released into the environment.
NJDEP Commissioner LaTourette and NJ Attorney General Platkin made the announcement on Monday, calling the deal the “largest environmental settlement ever achieved by a single state”.
The settlement follows a month of trial proceedings in the U.S. District Court for the District of New Jersey.
New Jersey was the first state in the nation to set a maximum contaminant level for certain PFAS.
The DuPont settlement will be published in the New Jersey Register and is subject to a public comment period before it can be finalized.
